Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, probably a lip-cup; interior: glazed black with part of tondo border consisting of three black bands and alternating added red and black tongues with faded added white dots between tips; exterior: in reserved handle zone, three black letters, probably the signature of the potter Ergoteles; lower wall glazed with reserved band.
Producer name: Attributed to: Ergoteles, Son of Nearchos (potter)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 5, no. 50b) (Illustration on pl. 4)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0573) (Phase 1)
Heesen 2011 / Athenian Little-Master Cups (p. 311, no. 514, pl. 126c-d)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 573)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
